p: Although no activity on T. cruzi was observed, a general biological activity against eukaryotic cells was appreciated for EO-ML. In particular, a higher sensitivity of kinetoplastid parasites than mammalian cells was found. Recently, Luna et al. [ 4] demonstrated that in the absence of new effective drugs against Trypanosoma and Leishmania, many studies demanded the use of EOs. In particular, da Silva et al. [ 21] reviewed the potential activity of EOs from 35 plant species against L. amazonensis, of which 45.7% had an IC 50 < 10 Î¼g/mL. Our results, together with reports in the literature, corroborate the antikinetoplastid potential of EOs and could stimulate the development of these natural products as a source of new phytotherapeutics for leishmaniasis and trypanosomiasis treatment.
